intro: Neesiochloa barbata, commonly known as the hairy beardgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and distinctive hairy nodes along its stems. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are often adorned with bristles or hairs, contributing to its common name. Neesiochloa barbata typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or marshy habitats.
